Bill Clinton Secretary of State Colin Powell says he is voting for Barack Obama . "He has both style and substance. I think he is a transformational figure," Colin Powell said on NBC's "Meet the Press." Barack Obama displayed a steadiness. Showed intellectual vigor. He has a definitive way of doing business that will do us well, Colin Powell said. Colin Powell , a retired US general and a Republican, was once seen as a possible presidential candidate himself. Andy Coulson has decided to resign as my director of communications, although I understand that the continuing pressures on him and his family mean that he feels compelled to do so," David Cameron said in an e-mailed statement. Andy Coulson has told me that the focus on him was impeding his ability to do his job and was starting to prove a distraction for the government.-- Editors: Eddie Buckle, Anthony Aarons. said the redevelopment proposal is integral to his overall strategy to permanently put the state back on sound financial footing. "This package only works with taxes, spending cuts and realignment," he said. Recapturing the property tax for its primarily intended purpose will save the state money because the things you do at the local level you can do more efficiently. Treasurer Bill Lockyer , a supporter of Jerry Brown 's proposal, described redevelopment agencies as "vampire agencies" because they are "sucking the blood of everybody around them for their own particular purposes."
